title: Trace: Missing Dictionary Key
story: A student tried to look up user information but got a KeyError. Reading stack traces is essential for debugging dictionary access issues.
instructions: Study the stack trace and buggy code, then answer the diagnostic questions.

hints.text: KeyError occurs when you try to access a dictionary key that doesn't exist.
The error message shows the exact key that was missing in quotes.

traceReading.stackTrace:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 5, in <module>
    email = user_info['email']
KeyError: 'email'

questions.question: Which key was missing from the dictionary?
How can you safely check if a key exists before accessing it?
questions.correctAnswer: Use .get() method or check 'key in dict'
